00022 /// @file   MidasEngine.cpp
00023 /// @brief  Iterator which reads input data files, calls
00024 ///         the MidasSpliceDetector for each probeset_id (gene) and
00025 ///         probeset_list_id (exon) data pair, writes output to file.
00026 
00027 //

00044 void define_midas_opts(PgOptions* opts)
00045 {
00046   opts->setUsage("midas - Microarray Detection of Alternative Splicing.\n"
00047                  "Usage:\n"
00048                  "   midas --cel-files cels.txt -g gene.summary.txt -e exon.summary.txt -m metaprobeset.txt \\\n"
00049                  "            -o out -pvalues -fstats -normalized -stabilize 8.0 -no-log-transform");
00050   
00051   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00052                      "",
00053                      "false");
00054   opts->defineOption("", "cel-files", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00055                      "File defining mapping between cel_files and experimental group_id.",
00056                      "");
00057   opts->defineOption("g", "genedata", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00058                      "File containing gene-level summary data.",
00059                      "");
00060   opts->defineOption("e", "exondata", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00061                      "File containing exon-level summary data.",
00062                      "");
00063   opts->defineOption("m", "metaprobeset", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00064                      "File containing mapping (meta-probeset file) between exon probesets and gene level probesets.",
00065                      "");
00066   opts->defineOption("o", "out-dir", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00067                      "Directory which will contain the midas output.",
00068                      "");
00069   opts->defineOption("pv", "pvalues", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00070                      "Output p values.",
00071                      "true");
00072   opts->defineOption("f", "fstats", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00073                      "Output F statistics.",
00074                      "false");
00075   opts->defineOption("n", "normalized", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00076                      "Output normalized exon intensities.",
00077                      "false");
00078   opts->defineOption("s", "stabilize", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00079                      "Stabilization factor for log data transforms.",
00080                      "8.0");
00081   opts->defineOption("nol", "no-logtrans", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00082                      "Do not log transform gene and exon level summary data.",
00083                      "false");
00084   opts->defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00085                      "Display version information.",
00086                      "false");
00087   opts->defineOption("", "keep-path", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00088                      "Keep cel file path.",
00089                      "false");
00090 }

00092 /**
00093  *  \brief Constructor.
00094  *
00095  *  Input data files have already been opened by the caller -
00096  *  here we copy parameters, perform minor size and
00097  *  option checks.  Output file headers have also already
00098  *  been written - here we open to append.
00099  *
00100  *  @param celFiles List of cel_file names.
00101  *  @param groups List of group indices.
00102  *  @param metaFileName Meta probeset file name.
00103  *  @param geneDataFileName Gene data file name.
00104  *  @param exonDataFileName Exon data file name.
00105  *  @param pvaluesFileName Output file name for p values.
00106  *  @param fstatsFileName Output file name for F statistics.
00107  *  @param normalizedFileName Output file name for normalized exon signal.
00108  *  @param wantPvalues Caller requests p values.
00109  *  @param wantFstats Caller requests F statistics.
00110  *  @param wantNormalized Caller requests normalized exon signal
00111  *  @param logStabilize Amount to add to data before taking logarithm.
00112  *  @param noLogTransform Do not log transform data.
00113  *
00114  *  Errors: exception if parameter checks fail
00115  */
00116 midasEngine::midasEngine(const std::vector<std::string>& celFiles,
00117                          const std::vector<int>& groups,
00118                          std::string metaFileName,
00119                          std::string geneDataFileName,
00120                          std::string exonDataFileName,
00121                          std::string pvaluesFileName,
00122                          std::string fstatsFileName,
00123                          std::string normalizedFileName,
00124                          int wantPvalues, 
00125                          int wantFstats,
00126                          int wantNormalized,
00127                          const float& logStabilize,
00128                          int noLogTransform)
00129     : celFiles (celFiles), groups (groups), metaFileName (metaFileName),
00130       geneDataFileName (geneDataFileName), exonDataFileName (exonDataFileName),
00131       pvaluesFileName (pvaluesFileName), fstatsFileName (fstatsFileName),
00132       normalizedFileName (normalizedFileName), wantPvalues (wantPvalues), wantFstats (wantFstats),
00133       wantNormalized (wantNormalized), logStabilize (logStabilize), noLogTransform (noLogTransform),
00134       spliceDetector (groups, wantPvalues, wantFstats, wantNormalized, logStabilize, noLogTransform),
00135       numGroups (groups.size())
00136 {
00137   // require at least one output option
00138   if (! wantPvalues && ! wantFstats && ! wantNormalized)
00139     Err::errAbort("At least one output option must be selected");
00140 
00141   // celFile list, group list must be of the same size
00142   if (celFiles.size() != numGroups)
00143     Err::errAbort("Mismatch between size of cel_file names, group ids");
00144 }

00146 /**
00147  *  \brief Destructor.
00148  *
00149  *  Delete each vector<int> in the map between probesetListId
00150  *  and its vector of probesetIds.
00151 */
00152 midasEngine::~midasEngine()
00153 {
00154   typedef map<int, vector<int>* >::iterator mapVecIter_t;
00155   mapVecIter_t mapPos;
00156   for (mapPos = probesetListIdToProbesetIdVectorMap.begin();
00157       mapPos != probesetListIdToProbesetIdVectorMap.end(); ++mapPos)
00158     delete mapPos->second;
00159 }

00163 /**
00164  *  \brief Read meta
00165  *
00166  *  Read meta probeset file.  Generate map between probeset_list_ids
00167  *  (from probeset_list column) and vector of probeset_id
00168  *  (gene) ids (from probeset_id column).  The correspondence
00169  *  between probeset_list_id and probeset_id id is potentially
00170  *  one to many.
00171  *
00172  *  Errors: call errAbort if any type mismatch
00173  *  (require that all id strings can be converted to an int)
00174  *  or in the case of any error return from NextEntryConverted().
00175 */
00176 void midasEngine::readMeta()
00177 {
00178   // printf("readmeta: %s\n",metaFileName.c_str());
00179 
00180   // We open and close the file here
00181   if (metaTsv.open(metaFileName)!=TSV_OK) {
00182     string msg = "Problem opening file: " + ToStr(metaFileName);
00183     Err::errAbort(msg);
00184   }
00185   metaTsv.m_optEscapeOk=false;
00186 
00187   //
00188   typedef const map<int, vector<int>* >::iterator cmapVecIter_t;
00189   //string stringOfProbesetListIds;
00190   string probeset_list;
00191   vector<string> probeset_list_vec;
00192   int32_t probesetId;
00193   int row = 0;
00194 
00195   while (metaTsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00196     ++row;
00197     //
00198     metaTsv.get(0,"probeset_id",probesetId);
00199 
00200     // This is a space seperated list
00201     metaTsv.get(0,"probeset_list",probeset_list);
00202     // printf("readmeta: probeset_list='%s'\n",probeset_list.c_str());
00203     affx::splitstr(probeset_list,' ',probeset_list_vec);
00204     //
00205     for (unsigned int i=0;i<probeset_list_vec.size();i++) {
00206       int probesetListId = -1;
00207       const char* s_start=probeset_list_vec[i].c_str();
00208       char* s_end=NULL;
00209       probesetListId=strtol(s_start,&s_end,0);
00210       // error converting
00211       if (s_start==s_end) {
00212         string msg = "Unable to convert '%s'"+probeset_list_vec[i];
00213         Err::errAbort(msg);
00214       }
00215  
00216       // has this probesetListId been previously seen?
00217       cmapVecIter_t probesetListIdToProbesetIdVecPos
00218         = probesetListIdToProbesetIdVectorMap.find (probesetListId);
00219       if (probesetListIdToProbesetIdVecPos == probesetListIdToProbesetIdVectorMap.end()) {
00220         // if not, store probesetId in a new vector
00221         vector<int>* pVectorInt = new vector<int>;
00222         (*pVectorInt).push_back (probesetId);
00223         probesetListIdToProbesetIdVectorMap.insert (make_pair (probesetListId, pVectorInt) );
00224       }
00225       else {
00226         // else a vector<int> already exists for this probesetListId - add to it
00227         // for now, do not bother checking if this probesetId has already been associated
00228         // with this probesetListId
00229         vector<int>* pVectorInt = probesetListIdToProbesetIdVecPos->second;
00230         (*pVectorInt).push_back (probesetId);
00231       }
00232     }
00233   }
00234   //
00235   metaTsv.close();
00236 }
00237 
00238 /**
00239  *  \brief Read, process gene data
00240  *
00241  *  Store cel_file data as a vector of vector of floats.
00242  *  Fill in map with key gene (probeset) id, value gene data row.
00243  *
00244  *  Errors: Call errAbort if the gene (probeset) label is a duplicate,
00245  *  in the case of any error in reading the input file or converting data.
00246 */
00247 void midasEngine::readGeneData ()
00248 {
00249   //int rv;
00250   // We open and close the file here
00251   if (geneDataTsv.open(geneDataFileName)!=TSV_OK) {
00252     string msg = "Problem opening file: " + ToStr(geneDataFileName);
00253     Err::errAbort(msg);
00254   }
00255   // printf("engine: readgenedata: %s\n",geneDataFileName.c_str());
00256   // The genedata file must have probeset_id as the first column. 
00257   if (geneDataTsv.cname2cidx(0,"probeset_id")!=0) {
00258     string msg="probeset_id is not the 0th column.";
00259     Err::errAbort(msg);
00260   }
00261 
00262   int row=0;
00263   int geneDataProbesetId;
00264 
00265   while (geneDataTsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00266     if (geneDataTsv.get(0,"probeset_id",geneDataProbesetId)!=TSV_OK) {
00267         Err::errAbort("Bad Conversion: probeset_id");
00268     }
00269     //
00270     if (!geneIdToRowMap.insert(make_pair(geneDataProbesetId,row)).second) {
00271       // abort if a duplicate
00272       string msg = "Duplicate gene label " + ToStr (geneDataProbesetId)
00273         + "in file " + ToStr (geneDataFileName) + " at row " + ToStr (row + 1);
00274       Err::errAbort(msg);
00275     }
00276     // printf("gdpid=%d ",geneDataProbesetId); // dbg
00277     // the number of data fields in gene data is the number of groups
00278     geneData.push_back(vector<float>(numGroups));
00279     //
00280     for (int col=1;col<geneDataTsv.getColumnCount(0);col++) {
00281       if (geneDataTsv.get(0,col,geneData[row][col-1])!=TSV_OK) {
00282           Err::errAbort("Bad Conversion: geneData");
00283       }
00284       // printf(" %f",geneData[row][col-1]); //dbg
00285     }
00286     row++;
00287     // printf("\n"); //dbg
00288   }
00289   geneDataTsv.close();
00290 }

00294 void
00295 midasEngine::openOutput_Pvalues(std::string filename)
00296 {
00297   pvaluesTsv.defineFile(PROBESET_LIST_ID "\t" PROBESET_ID "\t" "pvalue");
00298   pvaluesTsv.addHeadersFrom(metatagBucketTsv,TSV_ADD_ALL);
00299   pvaluesTsv.writeTsv_v1(filename);
00300 }
00301 void
00302 midasEngine::openOutput_Fstats(std::string filename)
00303 {
00304   fstatsTsv.defineFile(PROBESET_LIST_ID "\t" PROBESET_ID "\t" "fstatistic");
00305   fstatsTsv.addHeadersFrom(metatagBucketTsv,TSV_ADD_ALL);
00306   fstatsTsv.writeTsv_v1(filename);
00307 }
00308 void
00309 midasEngine::openOutput_Normalized(std::string filename)
00310 {
00311   int cidx=0;
00312 
00313   // first two are fixed
00314   normalizedTsv.defineColumn(0,cidx++,PROBESET_LIST_ID);
00315   normalizedTsv.defineColumn(0,cidx++,PROBESET_ID);
00316   // the gene data columns
00317   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < numGroups; ++i) {
00318     normalizedTsv.defineColumn(0,cidx++,celFiles[i]);
00319   }
00320   normalizedTsv.addHeadersFrom(metatagBucketTsv,TSV_ADD_ALL);
00321   normalizedTsv.writeTsv_v1(filename);
00322 }

00326 /**
00327  *  \brief Read, process exon data
00328  *
00329  *  Read exon data; for each row, access associated gene data using
00330  *  the previously constructed maps and write the requested output to file.
00331  *
00332  *  Errors: call errAbort for any i/o or format problem in the input file,
00333  *  if there is no matching gene id from the map.
00334  *  We also check for an error in the gene id to gene data row map - "should" not happen.
00335  *  Ofstreams are configured to throw for any file write error - no explicit checking
00336  *  is done here.
00337 */
00338 void midasEngine::processExonData ()
00339 {
00340   typedef const map<int, vector<int>* >::iterator cmapVecIter_t;
00341   typedef const map<int, int>::iterator mapIter_t;
00342 
00343   int32_t probesetListId;
00344   float fstat;
00345   vector<float> normalizedSignal (numGroups);
00346   vector<float> probesetListData (numGroups);
00347   float pvalue;
00348   //int rv;
00349 
00350   if (exonDataTsv.open(exonDataFileName)!=TSV_OK) {
00351       Err::errAbort("Cant open exon data: "+exonDataFileName);
00352   }
00353 
00354   int col_cnt=exonDataTsv.getColumnCount(0);
00355 
00356   // open outputfiles
00357   if (wantPvalues)
00358     openOutput_Pvalues(pvaluesFileName);
00359   if (wantFstats)
00360     openOutput_Fstats(fstatsFileName);
00361   if (wantNormalized)
00362     openOutput_Normalized(normalizedFileName);
00363 
00364   while (exonDataTsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00365     // suck in data
00366     exonDataTsv.get(0,"probeset_id",probesetListId);
00367     for (int col=1;col<col_cnt;col++) {
00368       /// @todo map names to columns
00369       if (exonDataTsv.get(0,col,probesetListData[col-1])!=TSV_OK) {
00370         std::string bad_str;
00371         exonDataTsv.get(0,col,bad_str);
00372         Err::errAbort("Bad float conversion: '"+bad_str+"'");
00373       }
00374     }
00375     
00376     // are any probeset (gene) ids associated with this probeset_list_id?
00377     cmapVecIter_t geneIdVecPos = probesetListIdToProbesetIdVectorMap.find (probesetListId);
00378     // skip it if not
00379     if (geneIdVecPos==probesetListIdToProbesetIdVectorMap.end()) {
00380       continue;
00381     }
00382     vector<int>* pGeneIds = geneIdVecPos->second;
00383     const size_t geneIdCount = (*pGeneIds).size();
00384     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < geneIdCount; ++i) {
00385       const int geneId = (*pGeneIds)[i];
00386       // map gene id to gene data row
00387       mapIter_t geneRowIter = geneIdToRowMap.find (geneId);
00388       // skip if not
00389       if (geneRowIter==geneIdToRowMap.end()) {
00390         continue;
00391       }
00392       const int geneRow = geneRowIter->second;
00393 
00394       // run the detector
00395       spliceDetector.runMidasSingle(probesetListData,geneData[geneRow],&fstat,&normalizedSignal,&pvalue);
00396       
00397       // dump the data
00398       if (wantPvalues) {
00399         pvaluesTsv.set(0,"probeset_list_id",probesetListId);
00400         pvaluesTsv.set(0,"probeset_id"     ,geneId);
00401         pvaluesTsv.set(0,"pvalue"          ,pvalue);
00402         pvaluesTsv.writeLevel(0);
00403       }
00404       if (wantFstats) {
00405         fstatsTsv.set(0,"probeset_list_id",probesetListId);
00406         fstatsTsv.set(0,"probeset_id"     ,geneId);
00407         fstatsTsv.set(0,"fstatistic"      ,fstat);
00408         fstatsTsv.writeLevel(0);
00409       }
00410       if (wantNormalized) {
00411         normalizedTsv.set(0,"probeset_list_id",probesetListId);
00412         normalizedTsv.set(0,"probeset_id"     ,geneId);
00413         for (unsigned int g=0;g<numGroups;g++) {
00414           normalizedTsv.set(0,g+2,normalizedSignal[g]);
00415         }
00416         normalizedTsv.writeLevel(0);
00417       }
00418     } // for
00419   } // while
00420   
00421   exonDataTsv.close();
00422 
00423   // shut
00424   if (wantPvalues)
00425     pvaluesTsv.close();
00426   if (wantFstats)
00427     fstatsTsv.close();
00428   if (wantNormalized)
00429     normalizedTsv.close();
00430 }
00431 
00432 /**
00433  *  \brief Process gene, exon data
00434  *
00435  *  Construct splice detector object, read in, process
00436  *  gene and exon data.
00437  *
00438  *  Errors: none detected here.
00439 */
00440 void midasEngine::analyze()
00441 {
00442   readMeta();
00443   readGeneData();                       // read gene data
00444   processExonData ();                   // process exon data
00445 }
